events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on 2024-04-29 late in the evening. The car received front-end damage after hitting a guardrail.
Claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and photos submitted by the policyholder.
An insurance agent specialized in vehicle accidents was assigned to handle the claim and contact the claimant.
The customer received formal acknowledgment confirming that their auto accident claim is now being processed.
Requested submission of police report, vehicle registration, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer promptly submitted the police report, repair quotes from the certified garage, and photos showing the damage.
Investigation team commenced reviewing the submitted documents and verifying details surrounding the accident.
Investigation confirmed vehicle damage consistent with reported collision and validated customer’s insurance coverage.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant outlining the approved repair costs and reimbursement details.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim process so far.
Claim approval was formally recorded, authorizing the finance team to release the payment for repairs.
Payment for vehicle repair costs was issued and transferred to the claimant’s bank account successfully.
Following payment, the claim was officially closed with all documentation archived for future reference.
Final claim files were securely archived according to company policy to maintain record integrity.
